metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2538 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in lib/rack/ssl.rb in the rack-ssl gem before 1.4.0 for Ruby allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a URI, which might not be properly handled by third-party adapters such as JRuby-Rack.

criterions.comment: ruby-rack-ssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
